intro: Allosorus seemannii, commonly known as the slender rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant features basal leaves that are linear to oblanceolate in shape, often with a hairy texture. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in early spring. Allosorus seemannii is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing a range of morphological traits that aid in survival in such conditions.
